edu.rit.pjmr

Class Mapper<IK,IV,OK,OV extends Vbl>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pjmr.Mapper<IK,IV,OK,OV>
  • Type Parameters:
    IK - Input key data type (data record ID).
    IV - Input value data type (data record contents).
    OK - Output key data type.
    OV - Output value data type; must implement interface Vbl.

    public abstract class Mapper<IK,IV,OK,OV extends Vbl>
extends Object
    Class Mapper is the abstract base class for a mapper in the Parallel Java Map Reduce Framework. See class PjmrJob for further information about configuring mappers as part of a PJMR job.

    A MapperTask calls a mapper's methods as follows:

    1. The mapper task calls the mapper's start() method. The arguments are the mapper's argument strings if any, and the Combiner that will accumulate the mapper's results. The start() method may initialize the mapper based on the argument strings. The start() method may do preprocessing operations on the combiner.

    2. The mapper task repeatedly calls the mapper's map() method. The arguments are a data record ID as the input key, the data record contents as the input value, and the Combiner. The map() method extracts an output key and an output value from the data record and adds the (output key, output value) pair to the combiner. Alternatively, the map() method extracts an output key from the data record and adds an (output key, null) pair to the combiner; this signifies that the output key exists but has no associated value. Alternatively, the map() method decides there is nothing of interest in the data record, and adds nothing to the combiner. The map() method may do other operations on the combiner as well.

    3. When there are no more data records, the mapper task calls the mapper's finish() method, passing in the Combiner. The finish() method may do postprocessing operations on the combiner.

    If a mapper task has more than one mapper, the mappers are run in parallel in separate threads. There is one global combiner, and each mapper works with its own thread-local copy of the combiner. (A mapper cannot see the other mappers' thread-local combiners.) When the mappers have finished, the thread-local combiners are automatically reduced into the global combiner.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(String[] args,
         Combiner<OK,OV> combiner)
        Start this mapper.

        The base class start() method does nothing. A subclass may override the start() method to do something.

        Parameters:
        args - Array of zero or more argument strings.
        combiner - Thread-local combiner.

      • map

        public abstract void map(IK inKey,
       IV inValue,
       Combiner<OK,OV> combiner)
        Map the given (input key, input value) pair to an (output key, output value) pair. The output key must be non-null; the output value may be null. The map() method adds the output pair to the given combiner.

        The map() method must be overridden in a subclass.

        Parameters:
        inKey - Input key (data record ID).
        inValue - Input value (data record contents).
        combiner - Thread-local combiner.

      • finish

        public void finish(Combiner<OK,OV> combiner)
        Finish this mapper.

        The base class finish() method does nothing. A subclass may override the finish() method to do something.

        Parameters:
        combiner - Thread-local combiner.
